name: Gobi Desert
hint: Large desert spanning southern Mongolia and northern China

name: Thar Desert
hint: Arid region on the India-Pakistan border, also called the Great Indian Desert

name: Siberian Taiga
hint: World's largest terrestrial biome, a vast boreal forest across Russia

name: Tibetan Plateau
hint: Highest and largest plateau in the world, known as the 'Roof of the World'

name: Deccan Plateau
hint: Large plateau covering most of southern India

name: Sundarbans
hint: Largest mangrove forest in the world, spanning India and Bangladesh

name: Western Ghats
hint: Mountain range along India's western coast, a UNESCO biodiversity hotspot

name: Borneo Rainforest
hint: One of the oldest rainforests on Earth, shared by Malaysia, Indonesia, and Brunei

name: Fertile Crescent
hint: Crescent-shaped region in the Middle East, cradle of early civilization

name: Maldives Atolls
hint: Chain of 26 coral atolls in the Indian Ocean, lowest country on Earth

name: Strait of Malacca
hint: One of the world's busiest shipping lanes, between Peninsular Malaysia and Sumatra

name: Bosphorus
hint: Narrow strait in Turkey connecting the Black Sea and the Sea of Marmara

name: Persian Gulf
hint: Shallow body of water between Iran and the Arabian Peninsula, vital for oil trade

name: Bay of Bengal
hint: Largest bay in the world, bordered by India, Bangladesh, Myanmar, and Sri Lanka

name: Khyber Pass
hint: Historic mountain pass connecting Afghanistan and Pakistan through the Hindu Kush

name: Strait of Hormuz
hint: Strategically vital chokepoint between the Persian Gulf and Gulf of Oman

name: Kamchatka Peninsula
hint: Remote volcanic peninsula in Russia's Far East with geysers and brown bears

name: Halong Bay
hint: UNESCO site in Vietnam with thousands of towering limestone karst islands

name: Taklamakan Desert
hint: Vast sand desert in China's Xinjiang region, one of the world's largest shifting-sand deserts

name: Korean DMZ
hint: Heavily fortified border zone dividing North and South Korea since 1953
